page.title: 17TEALING CHURCH
page.content: The church at{KIRKTON OF TEALING}is one of the oldest buildings in the area. The word 'Tealing' is Gaelic for 'country of brooks or water'. A church on this site was first recorded in 1174. The present church was built on the same site in 1808 and several inscribed stone slabs dating to Pre-Reformation times were preserved and built into its walls. One of these stone plaques is thought to bear the oldest known inscription in old Scots. In 1963 the parishes of Tealing, Auchterhouse and Murroes were amalgamated and Tealing Church was closed. However, it is hoped to restore the old church and turn it into a museum under the Church of Scotland Kirk Heritage Fund. Sunday morning services are now held at Auchterhouse (10am) and Murroes (11.30am).
